TopicTitle: The Man Who Stopped World War Three

Articles.Content:
I'm ashamed I didn't know about this man.

![Vasili_Arkhipov.jpg](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/f/f4/Vasili_Arkhipov.jpg)

Vasili Arkhipov was a Soviet Submariner whose actions at the Cuban Missile Crisis likely prevented a nuclear war.

[http://www.todayifoundout.com/index.php/2013/05/vasili-arkhipov-the-man-who-saved-the-world/](http://www.todayifoundout.com/index.php/2013/05/vasili-arkhipov-the-man-who-saved-the-world/)

This man deserves ***ALL***  ***the medals.***
Well, looking at his picture, he did get all the medals.
There was also some guy in 1983 who stopped the Soviet computers from retaliating against an imaginary missile from the US.

> 
> There was also some guy in 1983 who stopped the Soviet computers from retaliating against an imaginary missile from the US.

[This dude?](http://zidbits.com/2011/05/did-stanislav-petrov-really-save-the-world)

^ Man, getting forced into retirement for not causing a nuclear war. That stinks. They were "embarrassed" at their mistake, but how much more embarrassed do you think they would've been if he had launched the missiles?

> 
> ^ Man, getting forced into retirement for not causing a nuclear war. That stinks. They were "embarrassed" at their mistake, but how much more embarrassed do you think they would've been if he had launched the missiles?

Nobody would be left to be embarrassed.![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

- - - Updated - - -

And in the case of Petrov, while I don't deny that he is a hero, I'd imagine at least one of his superiors would have reached the same conclusion he did. Their job was to anticipate all possible scenarios for such a conflict. Arkhipov's case was different, as there was no chain of command for him to report to. His decision would've been final, and I doubt US forces would have hesitated to respond once a carrier group went up in a ball of fire.
What says Nobel Peace Prize more than actively stopping a potential global war?
